metadata.title: CVE-2022-28321 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - negligible
metadata.description:
The Linux-PAM package before 1.5.2-6.1 for openSUSE Tumbleweed allowsauthentication bypass for SSH logins. The pam_access.so module doesn'tcorrectly restrict login if a user tries to connect from an IP address thatis not resolvable via DNS. In such conditions, a user with denied access toa machine can still get access. NOTE: the relevance of this issue islargely limited to openSUSE Tumbleweed and openSUSE Factory; it does notaffect Linux-PAM upstream.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-28321` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpam-cracklib - 1.1.8-3.6ubuntu2.18.04.4
libpam-modules - 1.1.8-3.6ubuntu2.18.04.4
libpam-modules-bin - 1.1.8-3.6ubuntu2.18.04.4
libpam-runtime - 1.1.8-3.6ubuntu2.18.04.4
libpam0g - 1.1.8-3.6ubuntu2.18.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pam package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.8-3.6ubuntu2.18.04.4').
